intro: Ginnania racemosa, commonly known as the clustered ginnania, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months. Ginnania racemosa is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
